wikipedia_page.main: John Fletcher Moulton, Baron Moulton,  (18 November 1844 – 9 March 1921) was an English mathematician, barrister, judge and Liberal politician. He was a Cambridge Apostle.

response: * John Fletcher Moulton, Baron Moulton (1844-1921), judge, Liberal politician and writer, born there.

The son of John Fletcher Moulton, Baron Moulton, he was a barrister by profession. At the 1923 general election, he was elected as Member of Parliament (MP) for Salisbury in Wiltshire, but was defeated at the 1924 election. He did not stand for Parliament again.
*John Fletcher Moulton, Baron Moulton, English mathematician, barrister and judge
